descriptions.content: Examples: དམར་​​ཐིང་​​ཐིང་ “bright red” (blood), དམར་​​ལྷབ་​​ལྷབ་ “blazing, burning red” (ﬁre), ཚ་​​སོབ་​​སོབ་ “warm as toast” (pleasant heat)

The short form of certain adjectives is associated with repeated syllables with an expressive meaning. This formulation is used especially with adjectives of color.

  • འཇམ་ཐིང་ཐིང་ “Quite calm”
  • སྔོ་ཐིང་ཐིང་ “Bright blue or green” (like the grassland or the sky)
  • དམར་ཐིང་ཐིང་ “Bright red” (like blood)
  • དམར་ལྷབ་ལྷབ་ “Blazing, burning red” (like fire)
  • ཚ་སོབ་སོབ་ “Warm as toast” (a pleasant heat)
  • གྲང་སིལ་སིལ་ “Biting cold”
  • གཙང་ཧྲིལ་ཧྲིལ་ “Clean as a whistle”

Another commonly-used adjectival construction is formed in this way:

  • Adjective (long) + Adjective (short) + རྐྱང་

This is used to form expressive constructions implying “completely” or “entirely”:

  • གསར་པ་གསར་རྐྱང་ “Completely new”
  • ཚ་པོ་ཚ་རྐྱང་ “Really hot”
  • དཀར་པོ་དཀར་རྐྱང་ “Pure white”
  • ལྐུགས་པ་ལྐུགས་རྐྱང་ “Utterly stupid”
